TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

In DATE the applicant bought the attic of a house on FAC , GPE . In DATE she obtained a building permit ( građevinska dozvola ) and built a new floor and a garage ; in DATE she also obtained a permit to use the newly built part of the building ( uporabna dozvola ) .

On DATE the applicant filed a request with ORG of ORG ( Zemljišnoknjižni odjel PERSON u GPE ) , asking that the newly built attic and garage be entered in the land register as her property . On DATE the applicant further asked that the change in the street name , from ORG , also be recorded in the land register .

When the applicant failed to comply with ORG invitation of CARDINAL DATE to submit all the documents necessary for it to comply with her request , the court dismissed the applicant ’s request on DATE . The decision expressly stated that the applicant would be able to have her ownership recorded in the land register once she submitted all relevant documentation . The applicant ’s subsequent appeal of CARDINAL DATE was dismissed by ORG ( Županijski sud u GPE ) on DATE .

Meanwhile , on DATE the applicant filed a constitutional complaint in respect of the length of proceedings . On DATE ORG ( Ustavni sud PERSON ) declared the applicant ’s complaint inadmissible . It found that a constitutional complaint was not allowed in respect of the proceedings in question , since the decisions to be adopted in those proceedings were not individual acts within the meaning of section CARDINAL of LAW on LAW ( Ustavni zakon o PERSON , hereinafter “ LAW ” ) and thus not within its competence .
LAW , ORG no . CARDINAL of DATE ) provides :

“ In the determination of his rights and obligations or of any criminal charge against him , everyone is entitled to a fair hearing within a reasonable time by an independent and impartial court established by law . ”
The relevant part of CARDINAL of LAW ( Ustavni zakon o FAC PERSON , ORG no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE ) provides :

“ ( CARDINAL ) The Constitutional Court shall examine a constitutional complaint , irrespective of whether all legal remedies have been exhausted , if the competent court fails to decide a claim concerning the applicant ’s rights and obligations or a criminal charge against him or her within a reasonable time ...

( CARDINAL ) If a constitutional complaint ... under paragraph CARDINAL of this section is upheld , the Constitutional Court shall set a time - limit within which the competent court must decide the case on the merits ...

( CARDINAL ) In a decision issued under paragraph CARDINAL of this section , the Constitutional Court shall assess the appropriate compensation for the applicant for the violation of his or her constitutional rights ... The compensation shall be paid out of the ORG budget within DATE from the date on which a request for payment is lodged . ”

Under the case - law of ORG as applied until DATE , constitutional complaints lodged under section DATE in the context of all land registry proceedings were to be declared inadmissible . In decision no . U - IIIA/CARDINAL/CARDINAL of DATE ORG changed its practice , accepting a complainant ’s constitutional complaint and awarding him compensation .
